description.narrative:
Drawing from successful experiences, Oxfam aims to scale up this effective approach in additional provinces/regions and at the national level. In this proposed phase of work, the project will prioritize its expansion to the Central region/Ha Tinh province where Oxfam America’s Sustainable Rice Intensification (SRI) program has invested significantly in the past. Ha Tinh province is a poor province with a large number of ethnic minorities and high poverty rates that is frequently impacted by typhoons and other natural disasters. Rice is a very important crop for most of people in this province, therefore it is necessary to influence Ha Tinh province todevelop and approve a sustainable and inclusive rice master plan that can ensure the voices and opinionsof woman, ethnic minoritiesand vulnerable groups will be included, as well as ensuring governments and the private sector will follow up on their commitments as stated in the master plan.
The project will apply the methodologies that were adopted successfully in the last phase. Due to thecomplex gender and social issues of this region, the project will also flexibly adopt part of the Gender Action Learning System (GALS) tool in the planning process to ensure gender inclusiveness in the rice master plan. The project team and local partners will also make necessary adaptations to carry out planned activities in accordance with local health and safety guidance related to COVID-19 (e.g. organizing online meetings if possible and ensuring face-to-face meetings meet government prevention guidelines).
This project will also provide further support to follow up the result of first phase in Phu Tho and Yen Bai provinces by monitoring the progress of master plan implementation after one year of approval. The monitoring results will be helpful for provincial stakeholders as well as relevant actors in the rice value chain. This proposal fits within a larger body of work supported by Oxfam America.

participating-org.narrative: In Vietnam , Oxfam is one of the leading international, non -governmental organisation. Since 1955, Oxfam is active in Vietnam withhumanitarian interventions and started development work in the late 1980's. Today, Oxfam works in 26 provinces with people, governments and civil society to promote equality and well-being through social and economic change.
